    "NamespaceId": "test_ns",

RetryRocketMQDlqMessage.title: Resending a Dead Letter Message

SendMessages.document:
This example shows you how to successfully send a single message.
This example shows you how to work with unsupported non-persistent topics.
SendMessages.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: tdmq.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: SendMessages
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Topic": "tenant/namespace/topic",
    "Payload": "\"hello TDMQ\""
}
SendMessages.title: Successfully Send Single Message

SendRocketMQMessage.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: tdmq.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: SendRocketMQMessage
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ClusterId": "rocketmq-4k4orqgq",
    "NamespaceId": "test_namespace",
    "TopicName": "test_topic",
    "MsgKey": "test_key",
    "MsgTag": "test_tag",
    "MsgBody": "This is a normal message for Apache RocketMQ"
}
SendRocketMQMessage.title: Sending a Message Example

SetRocketMQPublicAccessPoint.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: tdmq.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: SetRocketMQPublicAccessPoint
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Rules": [
        {
            "Remark": "remark info",
            "IpRule": "0.0.0.0/0",
            "Allow": "true"
        }
    ],
    "PayMode": "0",
    "Bandwidth": "2",
    "InstanceId": "rocketmq-jxj3wj5j8e7",
    "Enabled": "true"
}
SetRocketMQPublicAccessPoint.title: Enabling Public Network Access Point
